lines.text: Enter OTHELLO, LODOVICO, DESDEMONA, EMILIA and Attendants

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: I do beseech you, sir, trouble yourself no further.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O, pardon me: 'twill do me good to walk.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Madam, good night; I humbly thank your ladyship.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Your honour is most welcome.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Will you walk, sir? O,--Desdemona,--

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: My lord?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Get you to bed on the instant; I will be returned forthwith: dismiss your attendant there: look it be done.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: I will, my lord.
Exeunt OTHELLO, LODOVICO, and Attendants

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: How goes it now? he looks gentler than he did.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: He says he will return incontinent: He hath commanded me to go to bed, And bade me to dismiss you.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Dismiss me!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: It was his bidding: therefore, good Emilia,. Give me my nightly wearing, and adieu: We must not now displease him.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: I would you had never seen him!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: So would not I my love doth so approve him, That even his stubbornness, his cheques, his frowns-- Prithee, unpin me,--have grace and favour in them.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: I have laid those sheets you bade me on the bed.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: All's one. Good faith, how foolish are our minds! If I do die before thee prithee, shroud me In one of those same sheets.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Come, come you talk.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: My mother had a maid call'd Barbara: She was in love, and he she loved proved mad And did forsake her: she had a song of 'willow;' An old thing 'twas, but it express'd her fortune, And she died singing it: that song to-night Will not go from my mind; I have much to do, But to go hang my head all at one side, And sing it like poor Barbara. Prithee, dispatch.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Shall I go fetch your night-gown?

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: No, unpin me here. This Lodovico is a proper man.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: A very handsome man.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: He speaks well.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: I know a lady in Venice would have walked barefoot to Palestine for a touch of his nether lip.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: [Singing]  The poor soul sat sighing by a sycamore tree, Sing all a green willow: Her hand on her bosom, her head on her knee, Sing willow, willow, willow: The fresh streams ran by her, and murmur'd her moans; Sing willow, willow, willow; Her salt tears fell from her, and soften'd the stones; Lay by these:-- Sing willow, willow, willow; Prithee, hie thee; he'll come anon:-- Sing all a green willow must be my garland. Let nobody blame him; his scorn I approve,- Nay, that's not next.--Hark! who is't that knocks?
Singing
Singing

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: It's the wind.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: [Singing]  I call'd my love false love; but what said he then? Sing willow, willow, willow: If I court moe women, you'll couch with moe men! So, get thee gone; good night Ate eyes do itch; Doth that bode weeping?

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: 'Tis neither here nor there.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: I have heard it said so. O, these men, these men! Dost thou in conscience think,--tell me, Emilia,-- That there be women do abuse their husbands In such gross kind?

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: There be some such, no question.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Why, would not you?

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: No, by this heavenly light!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Nor I neither by this heavenly light; I might do't as well i' the dark.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: The world's a huge thing: it is a great price. For a small vice.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: In troth, I think thou wouldst not.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: In troth, I think I should; and undo't when I had done. Marry, I would not do such a thing for a joint-ring, nor for measures of lawn, nor for gowns, petticoats, nor caps, nor any petty exhibition; but for the whole world,--why, who would not make her husband a cuckold to make him a monarch? I should venture purgatory for't.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Beshrew me, if I would do such a wrong For the whole world.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Why the wrong is but a wrong i' the world: and having the world for your labour, tis a wrong in your own world, and you might quickly make it right.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: I do not think there is any such woman.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Yes, a dozen; and as many to the vantage as would store the world they played for. But I do think it is their husbands' faults If wives do fall: say that they slack their duties, And pour our treasures into foreign laps, Or else break out in peevish jealousies, Throwing restraint upon us; or say they strike us, Or scant our former having in despite; Why, we have galls, and though we have some grace, Yet have we some revenge. Let husbands know Their wives have sense like them: they see and smell And have their palates both for sweet and sour, As husbands have. What is it that they do When they change us for others? Is it sport? I think it is: and doth affection breed it? I think it doth: is't frailty that thus errs? It is so too: and have not we affections, Desires for sport, and frailty, as men have? Then let them use us well: else let them know, The ills we do, their ills instruct us so.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Good night, good night: heaven me such uses send, Not to pick bad from bad, but by bad mend!
Exeunt
